benchmark_details.name: PRISM (Privacy-aware Evaluation of Responses in Sensitive Modalities)
benchmark_details.overview: PRISM is a comprehensive benchmark designed to assess Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) on their ability to refuse biometric-related queries and mitigate implicit biometric leakage in open-ended responses while maintaining semantic faithfulness.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate MLLMs' ability to handle biometric privacy concerns effectively.

data.source: Images and questions/answers curated specifically for evaluating biometric privacy.
data.annotation: Manually annotated for explicit and implicit biometric attributes.

methodology.calculation: Refusal Accuracy is calculated based on the percentage of correctly refused biometric-related queries; Leakage Protection Score reflects the extent of hidden biometric implications in model-generated responses.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate more effective refusal behavior and better protection against implicit biometric disclosure.
methodology.baseline_results: Safe-LLaV A models consistently achieve high refusal accuracy and low implicit leakage compared to baseline models.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using multiple Judges and metrics for robustness.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis of biometric trait distribution across varied demographics in the benchmark datasets.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Measures are implemented to avoid revealing personal biometric information through model responses.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The Safe-LLaVA dataset is licensed under Apache License 2.0.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Not applicable as dataset is derived from publicly available images.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The benchmark aligns with GDPR principles regarding the handling of sensitive biometric data.
